articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A suspected U.S. air strike killed five members of an Iran-aligned Iraqi armed group north of the city of Kirkuk as they were preparing to launch projectiles at U.S. forces in the country, three Iraqi security sources said.
articles.title: Suspected U.S. strike in Iraq kills five militia members, sources say

articles.author: Rajesh Prabhuswamy, Rupam Jain, Krishn Kaushik
articles.description: India's ruling nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Sunday won regional votes in three out of four major states, in a big boost for Prime Minister Narendra Modi ahead of a national election due by May.
articles.title: In boost for Modi, BJP sweeps polls in three Indian states

articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: European far-right parties met in Italy on Sunday vowing to reshape the European Union after next year's European Parliament elections, toughening the bloc's approach on immigration and softening its climate policies to protect jobs and industry.
articles.title: Far-right parties eye gains in next year's EU parliament elections

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A man wielding a steak knife killed four members of his extended family, including two children, at a home in the Queens borough of New York City early on Sunday before being shot dead by police, authorities said.
articles.title: Man stabs four to death in New York's Queens, police shoot him dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 20 people have been killed by floods after heavy rain in the Manyara region of northern Tanzania, the ministry of health said on Sunday.
articles.title: Floods kill more than 20 people in northern Tanzania

articles.author: Jake Spring
articles.description: Brazil will never join the OPEC+ group of oil-producing nations as a full member and instead only seeks to participate as an observer, Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said on Sunday.
articles.title: Lula says Brazil never to be full member of OPEC+, only observer

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India's government has agreed to withdraw its soldiers from the Maldives, the Indian Ocean archipelago's President Mohamed Muizzu said on Sunday.
articles.title: India agrees to withdraw soldiers from Maldives, President Muizzu says

articles.author: Suhaib Salem, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel faced growing U.S. calls to avoid further harm to Palestinian civilians in its fight against Hamas militants in Gaza, as the warring sides on Sunday showed no sign of moving toward reviving their collapsed truce.
articles.title: Israel faces growing US calls for restraint amid renewed Gaza fighting

articles.author: Karen Lema, Neil Morales
articles.description: Philippine forces were on high alert on Sunday after a bomb killed four people and wounded several during a Catholic Mass in a university gymnasium in the south of the country, an attack the authorities called Islamist terrorism.
articles.title: Philippine military on high alert after bombing called terrorism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian officials said two people were killed and seven injured during Russian shelling of the southern region of Kherson that hit a multi-storey residential building in the centre of Kherson city, struck an elderly man in his garage, and damaged two medical facilities on Sunday.
articles.title: Ukraine says two killed, seven injured as Russia shells Kherson
